Adult.description: Western Grebes have duller yellow to olive-yellow bills than Clark's Grebes. The black cap of Western extends down to surround the eye, but does not on Clark's.

Nonbreeding.description: Red-necked Grebes are smaller and less slender than Clark's Grebes. They have a stouter bill and are more gray-washed (less clean-cut black and white) than Clark's Grebes.

Nonbreeding/immature.description: Common Loons are larger and stockier than Clark's Grebes, with a shorter neck, a larger head, and a much heftier, daggerlike, all-dark bill.
